title: Billionaire Brownie

ingredients.name: large eggs, tempered to room temperature (about 4)
bread flour (or cassava flour for gluten-free)
sweetened condensed milk (for dulce de leche)

steps: MAKE DULCE DE LECHE: Heat sous vide bath to 185°F (85°C). Submerge unopened can of sweetened condensed milk and cook for 4 hours. Let cool before opening.
PREP: Preheat oven to 350°F (177°C) with rack in center for at least 30 minutes. Line a 9x13 inch metal pan with parchment paper, extending up the short sides. Spray with non-stick spray.
Sift flour and cocoa powder together twice. Set aside.

MELT CHOCOLATE: Set up a bain marie (bowl over simmering water at 160-170°F). Add chopped chocolates and diced butter. Stir occasionally until fully melted, about 10 minutes. Keep warm over the water.
MAKE ITALIAN MERINGUE: Add sugar to a small pan, pour water around the sides. Insert probe thermometer. Cook over medium heat to 248°F (120°C) hardball stage.
When syrup is 10°F from target, start whipping eggs on high speed until doubled and pale yellow.
When syrup reaches 248°F, remove from heat. With mixer running, slowly pour syrup in a thin stream into the eggs (avoid the sides of the bowl).
Whip for 15 minutes until cooled slightly and meringue has structure.
COMBINE: Turn mixer to low. Slowly drizzle in the warm melted chocolate. Scrape bowl and mix until incorporated.
Add vanilla, kosher salt, and miso paste. Mix for 1 minute.
Add the sifted flour-cocoa mixture. Mix on low for 2 minutes, scrape bowl, mix another minute until homogenous.
ASSEMBLE: Pour 1/3 of batter into prepared pan, smooth out. Drizzle 1/3 of dulce de leche in stripes and swirl with a skewer. Sprinkle chocolate chunks over top.
Pour remaining batter on top. Drizzle more dulce de leche and swirl. Finish with Maldon flake salt.
BAKE: Bake 48-50 minutes until internal temp is 195-200°F (91-93°C), or until toothpick comes out with moist crumbs (not wet). The center will dome then collapse when done.
Cool for at least 2 hours before slicing. Use parchment edges to lift brownies from pan.
notes: Called Billionaire Brownie because it's obscenely rich.
White miso adds a mellow umami that balances the sweetness - don't skip it.
The Italian meringue technique creates the dense fudgy interior and glassy crackly top.
Dulce de leche: sous vide at 185°F - 4 hours for caramel, up to 12 hours for darker/thicker.
For gluten-free: substitute bread flour with Otto's Cassava Flour (brand matters).
Use a metal pan for crispy edges. Glass or ceramic pans need 10-15 extra minutes.
Keep melted chocolate above 100°F or it will thicken and ruin the glassy top.
